events.title: The Big Bang
events.description: A singularity exhales, and time itself begins its long unfolding.

events.title: First Atoms Form
events.description: Protons catch electrons in a slow embrace, and matter finds its earliest form.

events.title: Cosmic Dark Ages Begin
events.description: The universe holds its breath in perfect darkness, waiting for the first flame.

events.title: First Stars Ignite
events.description: Hydrogen collapses under its own longing, and light is born from darkness.

events.title: First Galaxies Emerge
events.description: Gravity weaves clouds of gas into luminous islands adrift in the void.

events.title: The Milky Way Forms
events.description: A spiral of dust and gravity finds its shape, slowly, like ink in water.

events.title: Heavy Elements Forged in Supernovae
events.description: Dying stars scatter their bones — iron, gold, carbon — into the dark between worlds.

events.title: The Sun Ignites
events.description: A modest star catches fire at the edge of a spiral arm, unremarkable and essential.

events.title: Formation of Earth
events.description: Rock and fire gather into a quiet sphere, waiting to become a world.

events.title: The Moon Forms
events.description: A world collides with Earth, and from the debris a companion is born to keep watch.

events.title: First Oceans Appear
events.description: Water gathers in the low places, and the planet begins to dream of life.

events.title: Earliest Known Life
events.description: In warm shallows, chemistry crosses a threshold and becomes something that remembers.

events.title: Great Oxygenation Event
events.description: Tiny organisms breathe out poison that will one day become the air we need.

events.title: First Eukaryotic Cells
events.description: A cell swallows another and they agree to stay — complexity begins with partnership.

events.title: Snowball Earth
events.description: Ice wraps the planet pole to pole, and life endures beneath the frozen silence.

events.title: First Multicellular Life
events.description: Cells reach toward one another and decide, together, to become something more.

events.title: Cambrian Explosion
events.description: Life tries on a thousand shapes at once, as if dreaming with its eyes open.

events.title: First Fish Evolve
events.description: Spines stiffen in the ancient sea, and vertebrates begin their patient journey.

events.title: First Land Plants
events.description: Green things creep from water onto bare stone, and the earth begins to breathe.

events.title: First Amphibians Crawl Ashore
events.description: Fins become limbs, and the boundary between sea and land is crossed for the first time.

events.title: First Insects Take Flight
events.description: Wings unfold for the first time and the air, once empty, becomes a kingdom.

events.title: Forests Cover the Land
events.description: Trees rise tall and the world learns what shade means, what patience looks like.

events.title: The Great Dying
events.description: Ninety percent of all species vanish, and the earth must learn to begin again.

events.title: Age of Dinosaurs Begins
events.description: Great bodies move through fern and mist, sovereign and unhurried.

events.title: Pangaea Begins to Break Apart
events.description: The single continent cracks and drifts, carrying its passengers to new horizons.

events.title: First Mammals Appear
events.description: Small, warm-blooded things hide in the shadows of giants, biding their time.

events.title: First Birds Take Wing
events.description: Feathered descendants of dinosaurs lift from the branches into open sky.

events.title: First Flowers Bloom
events.description: Color arrives in the world like a secret whispered between petal and pollinator.

events.title: Asteroid Strikes Earth
events.description: A stone from the void rewrites every story that was being told.

events.title: Whales Return to the Sea
events.description: Mammals that once walked on land slip back into the deep, choosing vastness.

events.title: First Primates Appear
events.description: Small hands grasp branches in the canopy, and something watches, and wonders.

events.title: Grasses Spread Across Earth
events.description: A humble plant transforms the land, creating savannas where new stories will walk.

levels.name: The Rise of Kin
levels.subtitle: Branches diverge. A new shape stirs.

events.title: First Stone Tools
events.description: A hand strikes flint against intention, and the world is never the same.

events.title: Homo Erectus Walks Upright
events.description: A figure stands tall on the savanna, freeing its hands for what comes next.

events.title: Control of Fire
events.description: Darkness retreats from a small circle of warmth, and stories begin.

events.title: Hunting with Spears
events.description: Wood is sharpened with purpose, and the balance between predator and prey shifts.

events.title: Homo Sapiens Emerge in Africa
events.description: A new kind of mind opens its eyes on the savanna, restless and wondering.

events.title: First Use of Ochre Pigment
events.description: Red earth is ground and smeared, and the impulse to mark the world awakens.

events.title: First Use of Clothing
events.description: Skin is wrapped in skin, and the body learns it can go where cold once forbade.

events.title: Earliest Evidence of Language
events.description: Breath shapes itself into meaning, and thought finds a way to travel between minds.

events.title: First Burials with Ritual
events.description: The living lay the dead to rest with care, and grief becomes a kind of love.

events.title: Earliest Known Jewelry
events.description: Shells are strung on cord, and beauty is worn for the first time against skin.

events.title: Toba Supervolcano Eruption
events.description: A mountain tears itself open, and the sky dims for a generation of survivors.

events.title: Humans Cross into Australia
events.description: Rafts touch an unknown shore, and a continent meets its first storytellers.

events.title: First Seafaring Voyages
events.description: Someone looks at the horizon and decides the water is not an ending but a door.

events.title: Humans Reach Europe
events.description: Footprints appear in new soil, and the cold north hears its first human voices.

events.title: Oldest Known Musical Instrument
events.description: A bone flute sounds in a cave, and music enters the world like a prayer.

events.title: Neanderthals Disappear
events.description: Our closest cousins fade from the world, leaving only traces in our bones.

events.title: Domestication of Dogs
events.description: Wolf and human regard each other across the firelight, and choose companionship.

events.title: First Pottery Created
events.description: Clay is shaped and fired, and for the first time, emptiness is given form.

events.title: Cave Paintings at Lascaux
events.description: By flickering light, someone paints what they love onto stone, for no one and everyone.

events.title: Humans Reach the Americas
events.description: Footsteps press into a land bridge of ice, and two continents receive their visitors.

events.title: First Permanent Settlements
events.description: People stop walking and build, choosing a place to call the center of things.

events.title: Agriculture Begins
events.description: Seeds are placed with purpose, and wandering gives way to waiting.

events.title: Göbekli Tepe Constructed
events.description: Stone pillars rise before agriculture, and worship proves older than the harvest.

events.title: Domestication of Cattle
events.description: Wild beasts become companions of the field, and human life reshapes itself around the herd.

events.title: First Copper Smelting
events.description: Stone yields to metal in the heat, and a new age begins in flame and ingenuity.

events.title: Earliest Known Map
events.description: The world is drawn smaller than it is, and the urge to understand space takes shape.

events.title: Invention of the Plow
events.description: Earth is opened in furrows, and the soil begins to feed the many instead of the few.

events.title: Invention of the Wheel
events.description: A circle is set to turning, and the distance between places begins to shrink.

events.title: First Writing Systems
events.description: Memory escapes the mind and takes root in clay, outliving its maker.

events.title: First Cities in Mesopotamia
events.description: Mud becomes walls, walls become streets, and strangers learn to live as neighbors.

events.title: Domestication of Horses
events.description: A wild creature accepts a rider, and the world suddenly becomes crossable.

events.title: First Sailing Vessels
events.description: Reeds and courage meet the water, and the coast is no longer the end of the journey.

events.title: Great Pyramid of Giza
events.description: Stone is stacked against forgetting, a mountain made by human will.

events.title: Code of Hammurabi
events.description: Laws are carved into stone so that justice might outlast the judge.

events.title: Moses Leads the Exodus
events.description: A people walk out of bondage and into the desert, carrying a covenant and a destination.

events.title: Trojan War
events.description: A city burns at the edge of legend, and the stories born from its ashes never stop being told.

events.title: First Olympic Games
events.description: Athletes gather in a sacred grove, and competition becomes a kind of prayer.

events.title: Founding of Rome
events.description: A city rises on seven hills, not yet knowing it will name an age.

events.title: Confucius Shapes Chinese Thought
events.description: A teacher speaks of duty and harmony, and a civilization finds its compass.

events.title: The Buddha Teaches
events.description: Beneath a tree, a prince sits still until suffering reveals its own undoing.

events.title: Democracy in Athens
events.description: The idea that every voice matters is spoken aloud for the first time.

events.title: Construction of the Parthenon
events.description: Marble is carved into proportion, and beauty becomes a kind of argument for civilization.

events.title: Alexander Conquers Persia
events.description: A young king marches east until the world runs out, then weeps for more.

events.title: Ashoka Embraces Nonviolence
events.description: A conqueror surveys his battlefield and chooses, forever after, peace.

events.title: Construction of the Great Wall
events.description: Stone stretches across mountains, a scar drawn between the known and the wild.

events.title: The Silk Road Opens
events.description: A thread of trade and trust stretches between empires, carrying silk, spice, and ideas.

events.title: Julius Caesar Assassinated
events.description: Blades flash in the senate, and a republic learns that power always has a price.

events.title: Birth of Christ
events.description: A child is born in a small corner of empire, and time is split in two.

events.title: Destruction of Pompeii
events.description: A mountain buries a city in ash, preserving its last ordinary afternoon forever.

events.title: Library of Alexandria Founded
events.description: Scrolls gather from every shore, and a city tries to hold all knowledge in one place.

events.title: Cleopatra Rules Egypt
events.description: The last pharaoh holds her kingdom together with intellect, charm, and defiance.

events.title: Invention of Paper in China
events.description: Bark and water become a surface for thought, lighter than clay, more patient than memory.

events.title: Qin Shi Huang Unifies China
events.description: A hundred warring states become one, at a cost the land will long remember.

events.title: Hannibal Crosses the Alps
events.description: Elephants climb impossible mountains, and Rome learns that its walls are not the world's edge.

events.title: Fall of Rome
events.description: An empire dissolves like morning fog, leaving roads that lead to silence.

events.title: Rise of Islam
events.description: A prophet's journey from one city to another transforms the shape of the world.

events.title: Tang Dynasty Golden Age
events.description: Poetry, porcelain, and trade flourish, and China becomes the center of the world's imagination.

events.title: Charlemagne Crowned Emperor
events.description: A Frankish king is crowned by a pope, and Europe imagines itself as one again.

events.title: Invention of Gunpowder in China
events.description: A mixture meant for immortality becomes a weapon, and the nature of war changes forever.

events.title: Viking Longships Reach North America
events.description: Dragon-prowed ships touch a shore the mapmakers have not yet imagined.

events.title: First Crusade Launched
events.description: Armies march east in the name of faith, and centuries of entanglement begin.

events.title: Construction of Angkor Wat
events.description: Stone temples rise from jungle, a civilization's devotion made visible from the sky.

events.title: Genghis Khan Unites the Mongols
events.description: The steppe produces a conqueror, and the largest land empire the world has known takes shape.

events.title: Magna Carta Signed
events.description: A king is made to listen, and the idea of limits on power takes root.

events.title: Marco Polo Reaches China
events.description: A Venetian merchant walks the Silk Road and returns with stories no one believes.

events.title: Mansa Musa's Pilgrimage
events.description: A king crosses the Sahara scattering gold, and the world learns that Africa holds unimaginable wealth.

events.title: The Black Death Arrives in Europe
events.description: An invisible traveler remakes the continent, emptying villages and ending certainties.

events.title: Joan of Arc Leads France
events.description: A peasant girl hears voices and lifts a siege, and a nation remembers itself.

events.title: The Aztec Empire at Its Peak
events.description: A city on a lake commands a continent, its markets louder than any in Europe.

events.title: Great Zimbabwe Flourishes
events.description: Stone walls curve across a hilltop in Africa, proof of a kingdom the world forgot to mention.

events.title: Oxford University Founded
events.description: Scholars gather in a small English town, and the idea of a university takes root.

events.title: Dante Writes The Divine Comedy
events.description: A poet walks through hell, purgatory, and paradise, and the vernacular becomes literature.

events.title: The Inquisition Begins
events.description: Faith sharpens into interrogation, and doubt becomes dangerous.

events.title: The Mongol Empire Fragments
events.description: The empire that stretched from Korea to Hungary splinters, and new kingdoms fill the silences.

levels.name: Exploration & Enlightenment
levels.subtitle: The map fills in. The mind opens.

events.title: Fall of Constantinople
events.description: The last Roman city falls, and an age ends behind walls that could not hold.

events.title: Leonardo da Vinci's Notebooks
events.description: One mind holds art and science in the same hand, and neither protests the company.

events.title: Columbus Reaches the Americas
events.description: Two halves of the world collide, and nothing on either side stays the same.

events.title: Martin Luther's 95 Theses
events.description: A monk nails questions to a door, and Christendom splits down the middle.

events.title: Magellan's Crew Circumnavigates Earth
events.description: A ship returns from the direction it left, proving what the ancients only suspected.

events.title: Spanish Conquest of the Aztecs
events.description: An empire falls to strangers with horses and disease, and a continent's story is rewritten.

events.title: Copernicus Publishes Heliocentric Model
events.description: The Earth steps aside from the center, and the sky becomes immeasurably larger.

events.title: Shakespeare Writes Hamlet
events.description: A playwright holds a mirror to the human soul, and we have not stopped looking since.

events.title: Galileo Observes Jupiter's Moons
events.description: A lens reveals worlds orbiting worlds, and the heavens lose their perfection.

events.title: The Taj Mahal Completed
events.description: Marble becomes a monument to love, and grief builds something the world cannot forget.

events.title: Newton Publishes the Principia
events.description: Gravity is given a name and a formula, and the universe becomes mechanical.

events.title: Salem Witch Trials
events.description: Fear speaks louder than reason in a small town, and innocence burns in the name of certainty.

events.title: Bach Composes the Well-Tempered Clavier
events.description: Music finds its mathematics, and every key becomes a doorway to feeling.

events.title: Voltaire Publishes Candide
events.description: A philosopher laughs at the world's cruelty and insists we must still tend our gardens.

events.title: The Atlantic Slave Trade Peaks
events.description: Ships carry human beings as cargo, and a wound is opened that centuries cannot close.

events.title: Pilgrims Land at Plymouth
events.description: A fragile settlement clings to a rocky shore, carrying a faith and a future across the sea.

events.title: Mughal Empire at Its Height
events.description: A dynasty adorns the subcontinent with art and architecture, ruling a quarter of the world's people.

events.title: Captain Cook Maps the Pacific
events.description: The last great ocean gives up its secrets to compass, sextant, and relentless curiosity.

events.title: Gutenberg's Printing Press
events.description: Words multiply like seeds in wind, and knowledge escapes its keepers.

levels.name: Revolution & Industry
levels.subtitle: The old order breaks. Machines breathe.

events.title: American Declaration of Independence
events.description: A colony declares itself a nation, and an experiment in self-governance begins.

events.title: French Revolution
events.description: The old order crumbles in the streets, and liberty is shouted into the smoke.

events.title: The Industrial Revolution Begins
events.description: Machines begin to breathe alongside humans, and the pace of everything quickens.

events.title: Beethoven's Ninth Symphony Premieres
events.description: A deaf composer conducts joy into being, and the audience weeps at what he cannot hear.

events.title: First Steam Railway Opens
events.description: Iron horses begin to run on iron roads, and the landscape rearranges itself around the track.

events.title: Abolition of Slavery in Britain
events.description: A long cruelty is named, and the slow work of undoing begins in ink and argument.

events.title: First Photograph Taken
events.description: Light writes its own portrait for the first time, and memory gains an ally.

events.title: Pasteur Develops Germ Theory
events.description: The invisible enemy is finally seen, and medicine begins to fight with understanding.

events.title: Darwin Publishes On the Origin of Species
events.description: A quiet naturalist reveals that all life is kin, and the tree has no top.

events.title: Opening of the Suez Canal
events.description: A channel is cut between seas, and the journey from East to West loses weeks of waves.

events.title: First Telephone Call
events.description: A voice travels through a wire, and distance begins to lose its meaning.

events.title: Edison's Light Bulb
events.description: A filament glows in a glass shell, and the night retreats from human rooms.

events.title: Haitian Revolution Succeeds
events.description: Enslaved people overthrow their masters and found a nation born from defiance.

events.title: The Communist Manifesto Published
events.description: Two thinkers name the cracks in the factory floor and imagine a different world.

events.title: American Civil War Ends
events.description: A nation torn in two stitches itself back together, scarred but no longer divided by law.

events.title: Meiji Restoration in Japan
events.description: An ancient nation opens its doors to the modern world and transforms itself in a generation.

events.title: Eiffel Tower Constructed
events.description: Iron reaches for the sky above Paris, a temporary marvel that refuses to leave.

events.title: Gold Rush in California
events.description: A glint in a riverbed empties cities and fills a wilderness with desperate hope.

levels.name: The Modern World
levels.subtitle: A century of fire, flight, and fragile hope.

events.title: Wright Brothers' First Flight
events.description: Twelve seconds above the sand, and the sky is no longer just for birds.

events.title: Sinking of the Titanic
events.description: An unsinkable ship meets an iceberg, and human confidence meets its limit.

events.title: World War I Begins
events.description: A gunshot in Sarajevo echoes across continents, and the old world destroys itself.

events.title: Einstein Publishes General Relativity
events.description: Space bends, time warps, and a clerk in a patent office rewrites the cosmos.

events.title: Russian Revolution
events.description: A tsar falls, a new idea rises, and a century of tension is set in motion.

events.title: Women Gain the Vote in the US
events.description: Half the population steps into the polling booth, and democracy doubles in depth.

events.title: Penicillin Discovered
events.description: Mold on a petri dish saves more lives than any army ever took.

events.title: Hiroshima
events.description: A single bomb erases a city, and humanity holds in its hands the power to end itself.

events.title: World War II Ends
events.description: The deadliest conflict in history falls silent, and a shaken world tries to remember kindness.

events.title: United Nations Founded
events.description: Nations gather to talk instead of fight, a fragile bet that words might outlast weapons.

events.title: Indian Independence
events.description: A colony becomes a nation through nonviolence, and an empire learns that holding on is losing.

events.title: Chinese Revolution
events.description: A vast nation turns a page, and a quarter of humanity enters a new chapter.

events.title: DNA Structure Discovered
events.description: A double helix is sketched on paper, and the language of life is finally read.

events.title: Cuban Missile Crisis
events.description: For thirteen days the world holds its breath, and annihilation waits on a single decision.

events.title: Martin Luther King's 'I Have a Dream'
events.description: A voice rises above a crowd and names the future that justice demands.

events.title: The Moon Landing
events.description: Footprints are pressed into dust that has waited four billion years for this.

events.title: Chernobyl Disaster
events.description: A reactor fractures, and the invisible poison teaches the world what progress can cost.

events.title: Fall of the Berlin Wall
events.description: Concrete crumbles under the weight of hope, and a divided city becomes one.

events.title: Mandela Freed from Prison
events.description: A man walks out of twenty-seven years of darkness and into the presidency of a nation reborn.

events.title: The Internet Goes Public
events.description: A web of light connects the world, and every voice finds a wire to travel.

events.title: Hubble Space Telescope Launched
events.description: An eye opens above the atmosphere, and the universe reveals its depth in light.

events.title: September 11 Attacks
events.description: Towers fall in a clear blue morning, and the century finds its wound.

events.title: Human Genome Project Completed
events.description: Three billion letters are read in sequence, and humanity holds its own blueprint.

events.title: First Smartphone Released
events.description: A glass rectangle fits the world into a pocket, and attention becomes currency.

events.title: Paris Climate Agreement
events.description: Nations sign a promise to the future, fragile as paper, heavy as the atmosphere.

events.title: COVID-19 Pandemic Declared
events.description: A virus circles the globe, and the world discovers how connected and how fragile it truly is.

levels.name: The Far Future
levels.subtitle: All paths lead onward, into the quiet.

events.title: All Continents Merge Again
events.description: The land remembers Pangaea and gathers itself once more into a single embrace.

events.title: Earth's Oceans Evaporate
events.description: The seas that cradled life slowly rise as vapor, leaving salt and silence behind.

events.title: Earth's Magnetic Field Fades
events.description: The invisible shield weakens, and the solar wind begins to strip the air away.

events.title: Milky Way–Andromeda Collision
events.description: Two spirals pass through one another like ghosts, reshaping everything gently.

events.title: Sun Becomes a Red Giant
events.description: Our star swells with a final, slow breath, embracing what it once warmed.

events.title: Sun's Hydrogen Fuel Exhausted
events.description: The furnace that warmed a civilization finally spends its last measure of light.

events.title: Earth Is Consumed by the Sun
events.description: The world that once was blue is drawn into the star that gave it warmth.

events.title: The Sun Becomes a White Dwarf
events.description: A fading ember the size of Earth, our star remembers brightness only dimly.

events.title: Earth's Rotation Stops
events.description: The planet that once spun with life finally holds still, one face to the dark.

events.title: All Galaxies Beyond Ours Fade from View
events.description: The universe expands beyond seeing, and the sky holds only local light.

events.title: Last Red Dwarf Stars Die
events.description: The most patient stars finally exhaust their fuel and grow cold.

events.title: Last Stars Burn Out
events.description: The final embers dim, and the universe remembers light only as a story.

events.title: Proton Decay Begins
events.description: Matter itself unravels, atom by atom, returning to the nothing it once was.

events.title: Age of Black Holes
events.description: Patient voids inherit the cosmos, turning slowly in perfect, endless dark.

events.title: Last Black Holes Evaporate
events.description: Even the deepest wells of gravity surrender their hold and dissolve into radiation.

events.title: Heat Death of the Universe
events.description: All motion ceases. All difference dissolves. The path completes itself in stillness.
